intro: Plantago patagonica var. nuda, commonly known as the Patagonian plantain, is a perennial herb native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It features a basal rosette of broad, oval leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. The plant produces slender, upright flowering stems that bear small, greenish-white flowers in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along stream banks. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
